definitions.text: earnest and conscientious activity intended to do or accomplish something
examples: made an effort to cover all the reading material
wished him luck in his endeavor
she gave it a good try
He tried to shake off his fears
The infant had essayed a few wobbly steps
The police attempted to stop the thief
He sought to improve himself
She always seeks to do good in the world

definitions.text: put to the test, as for its quality, or give experimental use to
examples: This approach has been tried with good results
Test this recipe

definitions.text: put on trial or hear a case and sit as the judge at the trial of
examples: The football star was tried for the murder of his wife
The judge tried both father and son in separate trials
Try these new crackers
Sample the regional dishes

definitions.text: examine or hear (evidence or a case) by judicial process
examples: The jury had heard all the evidence
The case will be tried in California
I've been sorely tried by these students
You are trying my patience!

definitions.text: melt (fat or lard) in order to separate out impurities
examples: try the yak butter
render fat in a casserole

definitions.text: put on a garment in order to see whether it fits and looks nice
examples: Try on this sweater to see how it looks
